intro: Pleurostima, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Pleurostima species are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in their thick stems and leaves. Due to their rarity and specific habitat requirements, they are often considered endangered or threatened in many areas.
